channel.title: A Sci Fi great has moved on.
channel.description: RIP Ray Bradbury, You were one of my all time favorite writers and I enjoyed your storys when I was a young boy. You'll be missed but not forgotten. :[

item.description:
I’m in the club of people who only read 1984
I hear Fahrenheit 451 is similar and I will probably read it just because people expect me to.

item.title: A Sci Fi great has moved on.
item.dc:creator: Speed
item.description:
Eric Fong:

Can I join you? I don’t know who that guy is as well.

SURE, THERES ROOM FOR PROBABLY 1 MORE PERSON SENSE WE ALREADY HAVE THE DOC IN HERE.
I AM CELEBRATING INTERNATIONAL CAPSLOCK DAY EARLY.

(Im sorry if these two posts seem kinda dickish, but Seriously, i find some weird shit on the internet, like that chamber of understanding and ^that above^)

And dagon, you sound like this.

Saying shit and annoying everyone right now.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Rabbiddog
item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

Wah Wah your opinion is stupid you’re not funny I like her.

LOL! Your opinion might matter if I gave a fuck who you are…which I don’t. Wait, that means I don’t give a fuck. Yay!

item.title: A Sci Fi great has moved on.
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Eric Fong:

Francis hate Ayn Rand

He hates everything but vests, Louis, and Zoey.

The only Bradbury I’ve ever read was The Martian Chronicles. Some of the stories were more interesting than others, but it was obvious that he thought of some amazing stuff when writing them.

item.title: A Sci Fi great has moved on.
item.dc:creator: Jethrosoup
item.description:
k3nny1550:

You might be mixing it up with Aldous Huxley’s “Brave New World.” That one started off with a teacher and her students, and it was so incredibly dull that I put it down. Somehow, even “Atlas Shrugged” managed to be more compelling than that book.

Brave New World is a work of genius. Give it another shot.

Read full topic

k3nny1550:

You might be mixing it up with Aldous Huxley’s “Brave New World.” That one started off with a teacher and her students, and it was so incredibly dull that I put it down. Somehow, even “Atlas Shrugged” managed to be more compelling than that book.

He’s not mixing anything. He’s an idiot who think he’s trolling us hard.
